BR_text.BRsummary: MNIST-convnet is not working -- 'dataset' is not defined
BR_text.BRdescription:
Commit <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorpack/tensorpack/commit/c3f5307eb96a0efb313f4b4bbff5da18b1d80119>c3f5307</denchmark-link>
  introduces a bug,
 <denchmark-code>[0102 11:45:47 @logger.py:57] Argv: mnist-convnet.py
 Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "mnist-convnet.py", line 134, in <module>
     config = get_config()
   File "mnist-convnet.py", line 95, in get_config
     dataset_train, dataset_test = get_data()
   File "mnist-convnet.py", line 87, in get_data
     train = BatchData(dataset.Mnist('train'), 128)
 NameError: global name 'dataset' is not defined
 
 </denchmark-code>
 
 But <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorpack/tensorpack/commit/9c42c84fa682ba34110e1e0441ad84290f8e7b7b>9c42c84</denchmark-link>
  works fine.
 It seems that this new commit expect
 dataflow.dataset.MNIST
 instead of
 dataset.MNIST
 Is this intended? Then each example using these datasets needs an update.

comments_0.comment_text: I was making changes on import and introduced a bug.
